Text: Apple's Vision Pro is a technical marvel that showcases the future of spatial computing, but its $3,500 price tag and limited app ecosystem make it a tough sell for most consumers.
The Quest 3 is Meta's best headset yet, offering improved passthrough AR, better graphics, and a more comfortable design at a reasonable price point.
NVIDIA launched new AI tools and frameworks designed to accelerate the development of industrial digital twins for manufacturing, logistics, and robotics applications.
At Meta Connect 2023, the company unveiled Quest 3, new AI features, and a vision for how mixed reality will blend physical and digital worlds.
Despite strong technical capabilities, PSVR2 has faced slower than expected adoption, leading Sony to reduce manufacturing output.
Tech giants and startups are developing AI systems that can reason about physics, 3D space, and object interactions - moving beyond text-based LLMs.
Unity reverses its unpopular runtime fee policy after massive developer backlash, but the damage to developer trust may be lasting.
BMW leverages NVIDIA's Omniverse platform to create digital twins of entire factories, optimizing production lines before physical construction.
Apple's Vision Pro spatial computer will remain US-exclusive through mid-2024 as the company refines manufacturing and localization.
Meta's Chief AI Scientist argues that true AI requires world models that understand physics and causality, not just pattern matching on text.
Niantic continues to streamline its portfolio, shutting down multiple AR games to focus on its core franchises and AR platform.
Microsoft integrates its Mesh platform into Teams, allowing users to join meetings as avatars in shared 3D spaces.
Siemens adds generative AI capabilities to its Xcelerator platform for industrial digital twins and simulation.
Despite ongoing work on VR technology, Valve says a follow-up to the Index headset is not imminent.
Meta introduces a more affordable Quest headset targeting mainstream adoption of mixed reality.
NVIDIA's Omniverse platform aims to become the foundational layer for industrial and creative metaverse applications.
Apple is developing lightweight AR glasses as a more accessible alternative to Vision Pro, aiming for 2026 release.
Enterprises are adopting spatial computing for training, remote collaboration, and digital twin applications at scale.
Google scales back its AR ambitions, reducing investment in ARCore as the company refocuses on AI.
Meta integrates generative AI into its social VR platform, allowing users to create worlds and characters with natural language.
We're seeing 35% efficiency gains using NVIDIA Omniverse for factory digital twins. The ROI is real.
Just shipped our first Vision Pro app. The spatial computing SDK is incredible but the market is tiny.
LeCun is right: we need world models that understand physics, not just next-token prediction.
Quest 3's passthrough AR is a game changer. Finally seeing real mixed reality use cases.
Hiring: Senior Digital Twin Developer with Unreal Engine + IoT integration experience.
Attended AWE 2024 - spatial computing is moving from hype to real enterprise adoption.
Unity's runtime fee fiasco has pushed our team to evaluate Unreal Engine. Trust is hard to rebuild.
Combining computer vision with physics simulation for warehouse robotics. The future is multimodal.
Privacy concerns with always-on spatial awareness devices need to be addressed now, not later.
Using ROS + Unity for sim-to-real transfer. Digital twins are dramatically reducing prototype costs.
We need more open standards for spatial data interchange. Proprietary silos hurt everyone.
Vision Pro's eye tracking for UI is magical, but hand tracking still has latency issues.
Excited about JEPA (Joint Embedding Predictive Architecture) - finally moving beyond pure generative models.
Healthcare XR training is showing measurably better outcomes vs traditional methods.
Real-time physics simulation in Omniverse is incredible. Game engine tech meets industrial simulation.

We present a novel approach to learning world models using diffusion models guided by learned policies. Our method enables accurate long-horizon prediction of physical dynamics in complex environments.
We introduce Joint-Embedding Predictive Architectures that learn representations by predicting missing information in abstract representation space rather than pixel space.
3D Gaussian Splatting achieves state-of-the-art visual quality and real-time rendering for novel view synthesis, enabling practical NeRF applications.
Comprehensive review of digital twin implementations in manufacturing, identifying key technologies, challenges, and research gaps.
Analysis of privacy risks in always-on spatial awareness devices and proposed technical solutions for user data protection.
Methods for training robotic policies in simulation using physics-accurate digital twins and successfully transferring to real hardware.
We argue that spatial reasoning and physical understanding are fundamental capabilities missing from current LLMs and propose architectural changes.
Application of NeRF technology to industrial digital twins, enabling photorealistic 3D reconstruction from 2D images.
Comprehensive review of computer vision and sensor fusion approaches for hand tracking in virtual and mixed reality.
Integrating physics laws into neural network architectures to create more accurate and efficient digital twin simulations.
Analysis of eye tracking accuracy, latency, and user experience in commercial XR headsets.
Enabling AI agents to maintain consistent understanding of objects even when not in view, a key capability for spatial intelligence.
Novel approaches to minimize latency in cloud-rendered VR/AR applications using predictive rendering and edge computing.
Deep learning methods for estimating 6 degrees of freedom pose of objects for augmented reality applications.
Survey of industrial metaverse implementations across manufacturing, energy, and logistics sectors.
Vision Pro is genuinely incredible technology. But the killer app isn't here yet. Give developers time.
World models are the path to machines that understand causality and physics. LLMs are just pattern matchers.
New NVIDIA Omniverse updates enable real-time collaboration on industrial digital twins at unprecedented scale.
Quest 3 brings high-quality mixed reality to the masses at $499. This is the inflection point.
Spatial AI is underrated. The physical world has structure that text doesn't capture.
XR has been 'almost there' for a decade. Vision Pro is technically amazing but doesn't change that.
Multimodal AI that understands 3D space will be more impactful than pure language models.
After trying Vision Pro, I'm convinced spatial computing is the next platform. Just give it 3-5 years.
Industrial metaverse applications (digital twins, training) have clear ROI. Consumer metaverse still searching for PMF.
AI + XR for training is incredibly effective. Saw a surgical training demo that was transformative.
Still lots of engineering challenges in XR. Optics, ergonomics, battery life - all need another generation of work.
World models that can simulate physics enable entirely new approaches to robotics and embodied AI.
Privacy in always-on spatial computing devices needs to be designed in from day one, not bolted on later.
We hear your feedback. Unity is committed to transparent, developer-friendly pricing. Changes coming soon.
Unreal Engine 5.4 brings major improvements to VR performance and mixed reality development workflows.
